event_description: As an intimate invitation, without exciting however, exposure of BACKSTAGE PASS focuses not only on the final images but also offers a closer look at the work of 25 young emerging illustrators from 4 continents, who have studied together in graduate school illustration and creative communication techniques EINA. BACKSTAGE PASS is an open invitation to the curious public not only to see finished works, also to appreciate the process at different stages of each piece. Also it invites everyone to participate in the development of his own work as they sit in a dramatization of a study purposely created by the illustrators themselves. With works by / With artworks by / Amb obres by: Anna Baquero, Cobra, Elia Moliner, Esther Perabá, Hugo Cardenas, Ibane Cerezo, Ignacio Pimentel, Irkaitz Perez-Ilzarbe, Jansel Rubiano, JuanJo Calva, Liana Perez, Marcos Cuesta, Marina Arias, Llumbart Marta, Monica Toledo, Nafisa Nandini Crishna, Ona Marcet, Patricia Armada, Raquel Rodriguez, Rebecca Morgan, Rita Fittipaldi, Silvia Garde, Simona Galizia, Soojung Bark, Nuria Pujalte. Opening: July 7, from 19h to 21h. Open from July 7 to September 16. August closed. Opening hours: Monday to Saturday from 16 to 20 h. Sala d'exposicions EINA -. Espai Barra de Ferro Carrer Barra de Ferro, 2. 08003, Barcelona + info

event_title: Journeys. "In Transition - city. artistic practices and social spaces "
event_description: TRANSITION-CITY. Artistic practices and social spaces Debates, conferences, workshops, case presentations, urban route, projection of documentary. From 7 to 9 July in Fabra i Coats Contemporary Art Center C / Sant Adrià, 20. 08030 Barcelona Registration: centredart@bcn.cat indicating TABLE (S) OF WORK and / or ROUTE URBANA In ​​Transition - city are some days They developed in the framework of the interview Cohabitation Art Center Fabra and Coats in order to reflect and discuss cities as dynamic spaces in constant transition, movement and tension; and yet, as spaces where collective creation directed to its transformation articulated. During these days, and from lectures, workshops, case presentations and urban routes, it will consider how artistic practices and collective processes can serve as tools to enable transformative strategies that impact both the cultural ecosystem and contexts social about acting. The city, the urban environment, and more controversial, more dynamic, more complex appropriate, more shared, more creative, more political, ie "public space" configuration (re) is here articulated as space transition. Understanding the city as a work, as a place of enjoyment, as use value and, above all, as a collective creation, as a result of the decisions taken and activated by the citizenry. The conflicting and contradictory nature of public space requires many interested people involved in their reformulation, re-appropriation, reconstruction and recreation. Carry out these goals requires personal involvement and collective joint, more or less formally allow them to deploy their full potential transformation of the city as possible. In the (public) space in transition confluence of conflict and power relations, imbalances and social contradictions, the encounter with the other and isolation, leisure and speculation, beauty and desolation, opportunities and crises . It is the space of difference, relationships and emergencies that makes the city a place in a permanent state of boiling, construction and creative destruction. In transition- city puts in dialogue scenarios that are contributing to the transformation of cities and territories from diverse perspectives and positions, examples of contemporary transition taking place in the modes of production and active participation of citizens in shaping the public and contemporary urban space construction. PROGRAM 07/07/2016 | WORKSHOPS 5:00 p.m.. Conference. Artistic practices and political activism. AltArt (Rarities Zbranca and Itsvan Szakats, Romania). 5:45 p.m.. Case presentation. Torre David, a study in time. Angela Bonadies (Caracas). 6:30 p.m.. Debate (own rooms in the cycle). Who designs the territories? Azucena Klett, Ton Salvado and Gracia, where you're going? (Elisabeth Maluquer and Paula Martí). 07/08/2016 | WORKSHOPS 10:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. Work tables. Table 1. Practices and creative citizen action networks in neighborhoods. With Intermediae (China Cabrerizo, Madrid) and Space Sisters (Barcelona) Table 2. New technologies, urban exploration and community action. With Hangar (Marta Gracia and Constellations, Barcelona) and Dédale (Paris). Table 3. Mapping the territories. Approaches to Sant Andreu of Palomar. With Prostoroz (Alenka Korenjak, Ljubljana) 5:00 p.m.. Conference. Autonomy and art context. Jordi Claramonte (Madrid). 18.00. - 8:00 p.m.. Presentation cases. - Barrios in crisis, Ruben Martinez (Barcelona) - The Cabanyal, space resistance. Emilio Martinez / Maribel Domenech (Valencia). - Spaces open source, Ateneu Candela (Terrassa) - Inventing SSPA for art, Montse Badia (Barcelona) - Experience Amarika (Vitoria) 21:00 AUDIOVISUAL PROJECTION Picoteo + + cineforum 15 years Venus, Mariona Giner and Sergi Pujolar ( 2015), duration: 81 min Location: Fabra i Coats center for Contemporary Art Before the screening there will be a pica pica in downtown 07/09/2016 Art | URBAN ROUTE 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. sensitive Cartography. Memories, nightmares and Brossa La Mina and La Catalana in collaboration with desdelamina.net (David Stang), Dédale and various actors of the territory. Starting point : Metro Besos Mar 1:30 p.m. Vermouth. 'In Transition - city. Artistic and social spaces' practices developed under the Cohabitar Entrepueblos Fabra and Coats Center for Contemporary Art in Barcelona program - driven by Idensitat ID, LaFundició, Synapse and Transducers Collective pedagogies, and Artiz project. European Initiative for Art and Citizen, with the participation of Dédale, artart, Expeditio, ProstoRož, Transforms, Idensitat, Waag Society, Sinapolis. + Info

Rammsy makes music while Navy and Margherita dance. We observe and detect. There is no right place and everything is fixed. Intuitively, we react. Ballugues things. The contours of the mountains. The shapes of the trees. The way the wind brushing the grass. Clouds. And for some reason or another, we find things that balluguen difficult to track. And we tell people, you're still so I can see you. Stay still for the camera. And we say, fix things, we will do everything squaring. Upstairsbcn organizes and sponsors Beer Montseny. + Info

event_title: 02 Enlightenment and music: Music as creation engine
event_description: "02 Enlightenment and music: Music as creation engine" is an exhibition that explores the relationship illustration with music, beyond the illustration applied. Musicians / illustrators, illustrators / musicians ... artists who find their inspiration in drawing and music. They participate: Marc Andreu, COKE Azcona, Julio Bustamante, Maria Court, Mery Cuesta, Andrea Ganuza Carlos Leoz, Martina Manyà, Flavio Morais, Miguel Pang Ly and Marc Torrent. We will also have several events: A projection 12h documetal "Bustamante Perkins" (Audience Award In-Edit Festival 2013 Official Selection at the Dock of the Bay 2014) which will be attended by directors of Ministers Films Xesc Cabot and Pep Garrido and the protagonist of the film, the Valencian musician Julio Bustamante After the screening we will vermouth / chat with artists and guests. Free entrance. At 18h official opening with Moritz. We have the presence of the artists. From 21h we have organized a concert in Sonora grace with singer Julio Bustamante as part of programming. Films Cater To DJ dj's. Entry 6 €. The expo will be open until the end of September. + Info

The call set so organically a sample of contemporary international photography establishing partnerships between countries and photographic communities. + Info

Accuracies opening of the exhibition at the Wer-Haus: Thursday July 7, 19: 00h photographer Ari Versluis and The profiler Ellie Uyttenbroek have worked together since October 1994. Inspired by a common interest in dress codes correspond to different social groups They have been systematically documented numerous identities over the past 21 years. heterogeneous multicultural street scene Rotterdam, remains an important source of inspiration for Ari Versluis and Ellie Uyttenbroek, but since 1998 have also worked in many cities abroad. They call their series Exactitudes: a contraction of exact and attitude. By registering their subjects in an identical framework, with similar poses and strictly observed dress code, Versluis and Uyttenbroek provide, anthropological attempts of people to distinguish themselves from others by assuming a group identity almost scientific record. The apparent contradiction between individuality and uniformity is, however, led to such extremes in their arresting photographic lens view of appearance and stylistic analysis that the artistic aspect clearly dominates the purely documentary element. + Info

event_title: V Festival of Murals of La Escocesa
event_description:
This year we advance the dates of the V Festival of Murals of The Scottish to be held on 22 and 23 July! We have a line up of luxury with artists from around the world: Basco Vazko (for the first time in Spain!) And The Robot Wood coming from Chile, 2501 representing Italy, Nuria Mora from Madrid, Sixe Paredes as local representative and Paul Loubet coming from Argentina but is French and is responsible for designing the poster for this year. We will have live concerts hand Brother L come from Mallorca, Omega III from UK and Sun Color from Caracas / Barcelona. Dj Dave Tee NSO accompany dishes like every year with its oldschool sounds and drum'n'bass for the night! Apuntaros dates on the agenda because they will be two days of murals, expos and live music that you can not miss!
- With Paul Jean Robert , Sixe Paredes , Le Sepe , The Wooden Robot , Never2501 , ΩIII , Nuria Mora and Brother L .

NATURAL ABSTRACTION - Opening of the exhibition of a series of abstract paintings inspired by the colors of nature, especially the colors of the Mediterranean sea, sky and Barceloneta Beach. Paintings that explore communication of emotions and feelings through a graphic vocabulary of pure color almost "Rothkoneano" to transmit visual poems, expressions of feelings and emotions when contemplating the ever changing landscape of the sky and the Mediterranean Sea. A language of abstraction of pure color, combining colors and intensity to capture eg feelings to look at when the deep blue evening is night, and the colors of the sea and sky merge, the Strong Yellow beach sand illuminated the night comes ..... ciando to describe and capture the feelings and emotions of a moment to stroll among its colors, to lose yourself in the depths of abstraction of the scenic landscape. + info
